trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs processing an HTTP request.

This exception is thrown by the <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> class and its associated classes when an error occurs during initialization of the <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> or while creating or sending a response to an HTTP request.
For example, this exception is thrown if the <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> attempts to register a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefix that is already registered.
**Associated Tips**
Make sure you are not attempting to register a URI prefix that is already registered.
If the URI prefix is already registered, this exception will occur.
Make sure your HTTP request is valid.

This exception is thrown by the <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> class and its associated classes when an error occurs during the initialization of the <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> or while creating or sending a response to an HTTP request.
If you are using the `HttpListenerPrefixCollection.Add` method, make sure the `uriPrefix` has not been already added.
This exception will be thrown if another <xref:System.Net.HttpListener> has already added the prefix `uriPrefix`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.HttpListenerException"></xref> class.
This constructor sets the <xref:System.Net.HttpListenerException.ErrorCode%2A> and <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> properties using the most recent Windows error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.HttpListenerException"></xref> class using the specified error code.
The value of `errorCode` is used to set the <xref:System.Net.HttpListenerException.ErrorCode%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that identifies the error that occurred.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.HttpListenerException"></xref> class using the specified error code and message.
The value of `errorCode` is used to set the <xref:System.Net.HttpListenerException.ErrorCode%2A> property.
The `message` parameter is used to set the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that identifies the error that occurred.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error that occurred.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.HttpListenerException"></xref> class from the specified instances of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> classes.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the information required to deserialize the new <xref href="System.Net.HttpListenerException"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object.
Gets a value that identifies the error that occurred.
This property returns the Windows error code associated with this exception.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value.
